subject: Investing
title: Disposition Effect: Selling Winners Too Soon
description: A 60-second lesson on Disposition Effect: Selling Winners Too Soon.

hook.text: An investor sold Apple after a 30% gain in 2012. He held a losing stock for eight more years instead.

buildup.text: The disposition effect is the tendency to sell winners too quickly and hold losers too long.

discovery.text: It combines loss aversion (pain of realizing a loss) with the pleasure of locking in a gain.

twist.text: Research shows stocks that recently won tend to keep winning, and recent losers tend to keep losing.

climax.text: Letting winners run and cutting losers short is the opposite of instinctâ€”but it's the data-backed approach.

punchline.text: Don't pick the flowers and water the weeds.

quiz.question: What is the disposition effect?
options: Selling winners too soon and holding losers too long
